args: The Second War of Binding,\nthree hundred years ago...
Alberius, imperial reinforcements! \nOur western flank is being pushed back!
I'll send Chthonius that way!\nFight to your last, everyone!

The dragonblood heir, Alberius, was a savior to
many, humanoid and dragon alike. His strength
and indefatigable spirit roused the hopes of the
people.
I respected him as a kindred spirit. And one day,\nrealization dawned that my feelings ran deeper...
Still bogged down in paperwork at this\nhour? My condolences.
What else is an adjutant for? Incidentally,\nI've put together a list of eager enlistees\nfor our army. Would you like to see?
Mercenaries...but also farmers\nand townsfolk. So many.

Your actions have given them the 
courage to stand up to the Empire.
Which is all well and good, but that
comes with a caveat.
As our numbers swell, we're going to need\na bigger base of operations to match.

Borrowing a Templar office is fine for now,
but we'll soon wear out our welcome with
so many new recruits jumping aboard. And
we lack the means to construct a base...
So as our ranks grow, so too does the\nchallenge of keeping operations orderly.\nThat is indeed cause for concern.
I believe I may have a solution.
I speak of the Wooded City of Rovetelle.\nNearby lies a forest known as the Mistholt.
As you might expect, the wood is shrouded\nin mist, but whispers speak of a fortress\none can seldom glimpse through the haze.
Interesting.\nThis is the first I've heard of such a castle.
I learned of it from a dragon known as\nthe Wisp of Rovetelle. The edifice is not\nknown to man, or so the story goes.
The Mistholt... Hm. Mym, do we\nhave a map of Rovetelle handy?
Let's see... There's the Mistholt.\nIt's naturally fortified already,\nsurrounded by mountains as it is.
An ideal base for an army, wouldn't you\nsay? An ancient fortress being concealed\nwithin doesn't sound so outlandish.
Agreed. I stand convinced. We'll make\nour preparations and depart at dawn.
Yes. I would confirm the existence\nof this fabled keep firsthand.
You're the hero of the sacred sword.\nLeave this grunt work to me.
Save your breath. Now that he's heard\nthe call of adventure, he can't be swayed.
You're right. There's that telltale twinkle\nin his eye. At least let me come with you,\nall right, Alberius?
The Mistholt certainly lives up to its name.\nThe residents of Rovetelle said the haze\nonly thickens the further in you go.
According to our dragon friend, that's\nwhere we'll find the fortress. The mist\nmust be concealing it.
Visibility is only going to get poorer from\nhere. Hold my hand so that we do not get\nseparated.
Is there a problem with that?
They say there are fiends in here as well.\nIf we're caught without our hands free,\nwe could find ourselves in a real bad way.
But in fog this thick, the alternative\nis losing sight of each other entirely.
We can call out to each other\nas we walk, then.
Very well... We'll just have to be cautious\nnot to lose each other.
Mym, are you still with me?
(I say that, but I really am struggling to\nsee. We probably should have held hands\nlike he suggested.)
Oh. It was just a deer. Phew.\nGave us quite a start, eh, Alberius?
Alberius! Where are you?\nIf you can hear me, say something!
Uuurgh, I stepped right off that ledge.\nOw ow ow...
Rrgh, I think I twisted my ankle.\nI'd better
Fiends?! Of all the times...\nFine. Have at you!
This is hopeless. I can't fight them off!
(What an ignoble end. I'm sorry, Alberius.)
And I'm all bandaged up.\nSomebody dressed my wounds.
It's such a lovely castle...but no one's here.\nAm I where I think I am?
You are indeed. I chanced upon it while I\nwas trundling around with you on my back.
I'm glad you've finally come to.
Alberius, you saved me from the fiends?
Of course. Forgive me for letting us get\nseparated. I should've been more careful.
I'm the one who should apologize.\nHow long have I been out?
About a week, I would say.
A WEEK?! And you've been watching over\nme all this time, here in this castle?
It was touch and go for a while.\nI couldn't leave you unattended.
Midgardsormr's party should make their\nway here soon, I should think. For now,\nwe should rest and recover our strength.
Alberius, can I...ask something of you?
If something like this should happen again,\nI want you to forget about me.
Your purpose is too grand, too noble.\nYou're too important to risk me dragging\nyou down.
Is that what you think? Sorry to disappoint,\nbut I won't promise anything of the sort.
Why not? You're the hero of the sacred\nsword! Saving the world must be your \nfirst priority
I'll decide my priorities, thank you. \nWhat sort of hero would I be if I \nabandoned you in your hour of need?
I'll not weigh your life against the world\nitself. Both are equally precious.
And if I AM faced with such a choice...\nWell, I promise to make the right one.\nThat's all I'll say.
Now, a chill is in the air.\nLet's go back inside.
On that day, it finally dawned on me...\nthat I had fallen in love.
This is my story.\nOf how I lived for love, and how I lost my life.
